data.SQL:
SQL databases organize
data in structured tables.
data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases support
various data models.
data.NEW SQL:
NewSQL databases
maintain a relational data
structure.

data.SQL:
SQL databases employ a
rigid data schema that
defines the structure and
organization of data.
data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases have a
flexible schema.
data.NEW SQL:
NewSQL databases also
support a flexible schema.

data.SQL:
SQL is the standard query
language used.
data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases have
diverse query languages.
data.NEW SQL:
NewSQL databases also
use SQL for queries.

data.SQL:
SQL databases adhere to
ACID properties

SQL databases generally
do not have a distributed
architecture as a
characteristic feature.
data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases are
specifically designed to
operate in distributed
environments.
data.NEW SQL:
NewSQL databases are
specifically engineered
with distributed
architecture as a core
principle.

data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases may
have varied transaction
support.

data.SQL:
SQL databases are
suitable for traditional
applications with
structured data.
data.NO SQL:
NoSQL databases excel
with unstructured and
diverse data.
data.NEW SQL:
NewSQL databases cater
to scalable applications
with relational data and
ACID compliance.
